column1: Oral hypoglycemic pills are a class of prescription medications used to control diabetes.
The main (active) ingredient in sulfonylurea-based oral hypoglycemics stimulates cells in the pancreas to produce more insulin.

- Acetohexamide (Dymelor) - Chlorpropamide (Diabinese) - Glipizide (Glucotrol) - Glyburide (DiaBeta, Micronase) - Glimepiride (Amaryl) - Tolbutamide (Orinase) - Tolazamide (Tolinase) Note: This list may not be all-inclusive.
